subject: Dave Astels' "TDD: A Practical Guide"
msgSnippet: ... I see. To me, the book /is/ the example, so you can understand my perspective. ... Sounds good.... -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > Ilja Preuss wrote:
> >
> >> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >>
> >> > Get a copy of Dave Astels, "Test-Driven Development: A Practical
> >> > Guide". It's the best description of testing a Swing UI
> > with JUnit I
> >>> have ever seen.
> >>
> >> Well, I have to say that after skimming it for the first time, I am a
> >> little bit disappointed; especially about the chapter on testing
> >> GUIs.
> >
> > I don't understand the statement "the chapter on testing GUIs". The
> > whole book is about testing a Swing UI, and not just one chapter. What
> > do you mean?
>
> If I remember correctly (and I may well have missed something), the
> first part of the book discusses TDD in general and has a chapter on
> testing GUIs at the end. That is what I was referring to. I didn't yet
> take a deeper look into the second part of the book, the example Swing
> project.

I see. To me, the book /is/ the example, so you can understand my
perspective.

> I don't have the book at hand - I will try to comment in more detail
> later...

Sounds good....
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
